Expand description
Gotham – A flexible web framework that promotes stability, safety, security and speed.
You can find out more about Gotham, including where to get help, at <https://gotham.rs>.
We look forward to welcoming you into the Gotham community!
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/#reexports)

`pub use tls::start[](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/tls/fn.start.html "fn gotham::tls::start") as start_with_tls;`


`pub use anyhow[](https://docs.rs/anyhow/1.0.98/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/anyhow/index.html "mod anyhow");`


`pub use cookie[](https://docs.rs/cookie/0.15.2/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/cookie/index.html "mod cookie");`


`pub use hyper[](https://docs.rs/hyper/0.14.32/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/hyper/index.html "mod hyper");`


`pub use mime[](https://docs.rs/mime/0.3.17/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/mime/index.html "mod mime");`


`pub use tokio_rustls::rustls[](https://docs.rs/rustls/0.20.9/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rustls/index.html "mod rustls");`


`pub use plain[](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/plain/index.html "mod gotham::plain")::*;`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/#modules)

[extractor](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/extractor/index.html "mod gotham::extractor")
    Extracts request data into type-safe structs using Serde.

[handler](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/handler/index.html "mod gotham::handler")
    Defines types for handlers, the primary building block of a Gotham application.

[helpers](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/helpers/index.html "mod gotham::helpers")
    Helpers, e.g. for HTTP request handling and response generation

[middleware](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/middleware/index.html "mod gotham::middleware")
    Defines types for `Middleware`, a reusable unit of logic that can apply to a group of requests by being added to the `Pipeline` in a `Router`.

[pipeline](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/pipeline/index.html "mod gotham::pipeline")
    Defines types for a middleware pipeline

[plain](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/plain/index.html "mod gotham::plain")
    Functions for creating a Gotham service using HTTP.

[prelude](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/prelude/index.html "mod gotham::prelude")
    A collection of useful traits and macros that should always be imported.

[router](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/router/index.html "mod gotham::router")
    Defines the Gotham `Router` and supporting types.

[service](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/service/index.html "mod gotham::service")
    Defines the `GothamService` type which is used to wrap a Gotham application and interface with Hyper.

[state](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/state/index.html "mod gotham::state")
    Defines types for passing request state through `Middleware` and `Handler` implementations

[test](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/test/index.html "mod gotham::test")
    Test utilities for Gotham and Gotham consumer apps.

[tls](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/tls/index.html "mod gotham::tls")
    Functions for creating a Gotham service using HTTPS.
## Enums[§](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/#enums)

[StartError](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/enum.StartError.html "enum gotham::StartError")
    The error that can occur when starting the gotham server.
## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/#functions)

[bind_server](https://docs.rs/gotham/latest/gotham/fn.bind_server.html "fn gotham::bind_server")
    Returns a `Future` used to spawn a Gotham application.

readme_summary: The `gotham` crate is a flexible and fast web framework for Rust, emphasizing stability, safety, and security. It provides key features such as type-safe request data extraction using Serde, middleware pipelines, a robust routing system, and HTTPS support via `tokio_rustls`. Additional utilities include testing tools, state management, and integration with popular libraries like `hyper`, `cookie`, and `mime`.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Middleware and Pipeline  
✅ Factual: Gotham provides a `middleware` module that allows developers to define reusable logic, which can be applied to a group of requests by integrating it into a `Pipeline`.  
❌ Counterfactual: Gotham requires middleware to be defined inline within handler functions, as it does not support reusable middleware logic.  

---

### Pair 2: HTTPS Support  
✅ Factual: Gotham includes a `tls` module that enables developers to create secure HTTPS services using the `start_with_tls` function.  
❌ Counterfactual: Gotham does not support HTTPS out of the box and requires external crates for TLS integration.  

---

### Pair 3: Request Data Extraction  
✅ Factual: Gotham's `extractor` module uses Serde to extract request data into type-safe structs, simplifying data handling in web applications.  
❌ Counterfactual: Gotham's `extractor` module requires developers to manually parse and validate request data without the help of Serde.
